title: Ummmmmm... Riot, I think we have a problem.
body: So I was queued up for a normal draft match and right off the bat I was disconnected from chat. Then one of the players on the other team waited until literally 0 seconds to ban. I was first to ban on my team, and when the screen popped up, I had about 3 seconds to ban. I had to click a random champion and spam the ban button and hope for the best. But, sadly I was banned from the queue for 6 minutes. So my ultimate question is, will this count towards me being permanently banned?

replies.body: He could just be using the New Client. The new client (at least when I played it) had such connectivity issues that I literally could not choose champion, or pick runes/masteries. I thankfully tested out on an ARAM so I still got into the game, but these problems only arose when I wasn't on the Legacy Client (which I switched back to and have stayed on since).

Nope, that's just a *queue dodge* sort of low-priority queue. You should be fine, but it sounds like there may have been some connectivity issues between you and the matchmaking servers, so you may want to work through our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to prevent this from happening again.

Let me know if you have any questions!
Leaving the game, afking or failing to lock in a champion or ban will never be a bannable offence, at worst you'll get a lpq of up to 20 min for 5 games.
